s1: This course provides basic approaches for designing and analysing algorithms and data structures.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: It will focus on two fundamental problems in computing: Sorting and searching.
s2: Expand conventional attack patterns to work in new system and network architectures.

s1: It will cover various data structures and algorithm design techniques for solving these two classes of problems, as well as basic performance measures and analysis techniques for solving such problems.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: Display an advanced understanding of a variety of algorithms, including linear selection, minimum spanning trees, single source shortest path, Huffman coding, etc, with real-life applications and the resource requirements.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: Expertly apply the most effective algorithmic techniques including dynamic programming, greedy policy, and divide-and-conquer, to solve some practical problems.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: Define and analyse time and space complexities of algorithms.
s2: Expand conventional attack patterns to work in new system and network architectures.

s1: Demonstrate experience in the design and implementation of algorithms for practical problems, using languages like C, C++.
s2: Analyze a system across all abstraction levels, from basic hardware to complex cloud architectures.
